intro: Calamus phuocbinhensis, commonly known as Phuoc Binh screw pine, is a rare and endemic plant species found in the mountainous regions of Vietnam. It belongs to the family Arales and is characterized by its unique morphology, including long, narrow leaves and a climbing habit. The plant is notable for its ability to thrive in humid, shaded environments, often found in dense forests. Its botanical significance lies in its role as an indicator species for undisturbed ecosystems. Due to habitat loss, it is considered threatened and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
